citation.case_name: Courtesy Sandwich Shop, Inc. v. Port of New York Authority

html:
375 U.S. 78

84 S.Ct. 194

11 L.Ed.2d 141

COURTESY SANDWICH SHOP, INC., et al.
v.
PORT OF NEW YORK AUTHORITY et al.

No. 399.

Supreme Court of the United States

November 12, 1963

Rehearing Denied Dec. 16, 1963.

See 375 U.S. 960, 84 S.Ct. 440.

Edward S. Greenbaum, Morris L. Ernst, Leo Rosen, W. Bernard Richland and Jerome M. Alper, for appellants.

Sidney Goldstein and Daniel B. Goldberg, for appellees.

Louis J. Lefkowitz, Atty. Gen. of New York, Samuel A. Hirshowitz, First Asst. Atty. Gen., Daniel M. Cohen, Asst. Atty. Gen., Arthur J. Sills, Atty. Gen. of New Jersey, and Theodore I. Botter, First Asst. Atty. Gen., for intervenor-appellees.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion to dismiss is granted and the appeal is dismissed for want of a substantial federal question.
